18.40 Lakh On road price, Delhi Delhi Starting 13,193 /month EMI calculator Get EMI offers Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Introduction**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is the latest entrant in the competitive compact SUV segment in India. It represents a significant upgrade from its predecessor, the XUV300, with a refreshed design, enhanced features, and a greater emphasis on both luxury and safety. Mahindra aims to capture a significant share of the market by offering a well-rounded vehicle that caters to the evolving needs and preferences of modern car buyers. The XUV 3XO boasts a 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating, underscoring its commitment to passenger safety.

**General Features**

*   **Design and Styling:** The XUV 3XO features a dynamic and robust exterior design. Key design elements include vertically oriented headlights, C-shaped DRLs, and a gloss panel grille. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, contributing to its sporty and modern appearance.
*   **Engine and Performance:** The XUV 3XO offers a choice of petrol and diesel engines. The petrol options include a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI engine and a 1.2-liter TGDi turbo direct injection engine, with the latter producing 130hp and 230Nm of torque. The diesel engine is a 1.5-liter unit producing 117 PS. These engines are paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options.
*   **Dimensions and Capacity:** The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a height of 1647 mm. It has a wheelbase of 2600 mm and a boot capacity of 364 litres. The vehicle comfortably seats five passengers.
*   **Fuel Efficiency:** The petrol variants offer a mileage ranging from 17.96 kmpl to 20.1 kmpl, while the diesel variants offer around 20.6 kmpl to 21.2 kmpl.

**Luxury Features**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to provide a luxurious and comfortable experience for both the driver and passengers. The interior features premium materials, advanced technology, and several comfort-enhancing features.

*   **Interior Design:** The interior of the XUV 3XO is designed with sophistication and comfort in mind. It features soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard, enhancing the tactile experience. Premium leatherette seats add to the luxurious feel, providing comfortable support during long drives.
*   **Infotainment System:** The XUV 3XO comes with a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation. The system includes built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment and control. The Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system enhances the auditory experience, creating an immersive sound environment. ADRENOX Connect technology allows users to control various car features through their smartphones, providing convenience and connectivity.
*   **Comfort and Convenience:** The XUV 3XO offers several comfort and convenience features. These include a panoramic sunroof (Skyroof), cooled glovebox with illumination, and passive keyless entry. The front armrest with storage and console with cup holders provide additional convenience for the driver and front passenger. Features like automatic climate control, rear AC vents, and adjustable headrests contribute to the overall comfort of the cabin.
*   **Advanced Technology:** The XUV 3XO incorporates advanced technology to enhance the driving experience. Smart steering modes allow the driver to customize the steering feel. Automatic wipers and headlights adjust to the weather conditions, providing added safety and convenience. The digital instrument cluster provides essential information in a clear and concise manner.

**Safety Features**

Mahindra has prioritized safety in the design and engineering of the XUV 3XO. The vehicle is equipped with a comprehensive suite of active and passive safety features to protect occupants in the event of a collision and prevent accidents.

*   **Active Safety Features:** The XUV 3XO includes Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD) and Brake Assist (BA). These systems help maintain control during emergency braking situations. Electronic Stability Control (ESC) helps prevent skidding and loss of control, especially on slippery surfaces.
*   **Passive Safety Features:** The XUV 3XO is equipped with up to 6 airbags, providing crucial protection in the event of a collision. The robust build and structural integrity of the vehicle are designed to absorb and distribute impact forces, minimizing injury to occupants. The XUV 3XO achieved a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, demonstrating its commitment to safety standards.
*   **Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS):** The XUV 3XO features Level 2 ADAS, which includes features such as Forward Collision Warning, Adaptive Cruise Control, and Lane Keeping Assist. These systems help prevent accidents by alerting the driver to potential hazards and providing assistance to maintain a safe driving position.

**Conclusion**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling option in the compact SUV segment, offering a blend of style, comfort, technology, and safety. Its modern design, luxurious interior, advanced features, and comprehensive safety systems make it a strong contender against established rivals. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating further enhances its appeal, providing customers with confidence in its safety performance. Mahindra aims to cater to the evolving needs of modern car buyers by delivering a well-rounded vehicle that excels in all key areas.

## Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that combines modern design with advanced features, focusing on luxury and safety. It offers a comfortable interior, a range of technology, and comprehensive safety systems. The report provides an overview of its features, luxury enhancements, and safety technologies.

## General Features

*   Engine and Performance: Petrol and diesel engine options.

*   Interior Design: Soft-touch leatherette, premium seats.
*   Infotainment System: High-definition touchscreen, Amazon Alexa.
*   Comfort and Convenience: Panoramic sunroof, cooled glovebox.
*   Advanced Technology: Smart steering modes, automatic wipers.

## Safety Features

*   Active Safety Features: ABS with EBD and BA.
*   Passive Safety Features: Up to 6 airbags, robust build.
*   Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS): Level 2 ADAS.

18.40 Lakh On road price, Delhi Delhi Starting 13,193 /month EMI calculator Get EMI offers Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. 18.40 Lakh On road price, Delhi Delhi Starting 13,193 /month EMI calculator Get EMI offers Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: 

**Introduction**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is the latest entrant in the competitive compact SUV segment in India. It represents a significant upgrade from its predecessor, the XUV300, with a refreshed design, enhanced features, and a greater emphasis on both luxury and safety. Mahindra aims to capture a significant share of the market by offering a well-rounded vehicle that caters to the evolving needs and preferences of modern car buyers. The XUV 3XO boasts a 5-star Bharat NCAP safety rating, underscoring its commitment to passenger safety.

**General Features**

*   **Design and Styling:** The XUV 3XO features a dynamic and robust exterior design. Key design elements include vertically oriented headlights, C-shaped DRLs, and a gloss panel grille. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, contributing to its sporty and modern appearance.
*   **Engine and Performance:** The XUV 3XO offers a choice of petrol and diesel engines. The petrol options include a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI engine and a 1.2-liter TGDi turbo direct injection engine, with the latter producing 130hp and 230Nm of torque. The diesel engine is a 1.5-liter unit producing 117 PS. These engines are paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options.
*   **Dimensions and Capacity:** The XUV 3XO has a length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm, and a height of 1647 mm. It has a wheelbase of 2600 mm and a boot capacity of 364 litres. The vehicle comfortably seats five passengers.
*   **Fuel Efficiency:** The petrol variants offer a mileage ranging from 17.96 kmpl to 20.1 kmpl, while the diesel variants offer around 20.6 kmpl to 21.2 kmpl.

**Luxury Features**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to provide a luxurious and comfortable experience for both the driver and passengers. The interior features premium materials, advanced technology, and several comfort-enhancing features.

*   **Interior Design:** The interior of the XUV 3XO is designed with sophistication and comfort in mind. It features soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard, enhancing the tactile experience. Premium leatherette seats add to the luxurious feel, providing comfortable support during long drives.
*   **Infotainment System:** The XUV 3XO comes with a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation. The system includes built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment and control. The Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system enhances the auditory experience, creating an immersive sound environment. ADRENOX Connect technology allows users to control various car features through their smartphones, providing convenience and connectivity.
*   **Comfort and Convenience:** The XUV 3XO offers several comfort and convenience features. These include a panoramic sunroof (Skyroof), cooled glovebox with illumination, and passive keyless entry. The front armrest with storage and console with cup holders provide additional convenience for the driver and front passenger. Features like automatic climate control, rear AC vents, and adjustable headrests contribute to the overall comfort of the cabin.
*   **Advanced Technology:** The XUV 3XO incorporates advanced technology to enhance the driving experience. Smart steering modes allow the driver to customize the steering feel. Automatic wipers and headlights adjust to the weather conditions, providing added safety and convenience. The digital instrument cluster provides essential information in a clear and concise manner.

**Safety Features**

Mahindra has prioritized safety in the design and engineering of the XUV 3XO. The vehicle is equipped with a comprehensive suite of active and passive safety features to protect occupants in the event of a collision and prevent accidents.

*   **Active Safety Features:** The XUV 3XO includes Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) with Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD) and Brake Assist (BA). These systems help maintain control during emergency braking situations. Electronic Stability Control (ESC) helps prevent skidding and loss of control, especially on slippery surfaces.
*   **Passive Safety Features:** The XUV 3XO is equipped with up to 6 airbags, providing crucial protection in the event of a collision. The robust build and structural integrity of the vehicle are designed to absorb and distribute impact forces, minimizing injury to occupants. The XUV 3XO achieved a 5-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, demonstrating its commitment to safety standards.
*   **Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS):** The XUV 3XO features Level 2 ADAS, which includes features such as Forward Collision Warning, Adaptive Cruise Control, and Lane Keeping Assist. These systems help prevent accidents by alerting the driver to potential hazards and providing assistance to maintain a safe driving position.

**Conclusion**

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compelling option in the compact SUV segment, offering a blend of style, comfort, technology, and safety. Its modern design, luxurious interior, advanced features, and comprehensive safety systems make it a strong contender against established rivals. The 5-star Bharat NCAP rating further enhances its appeal, providing customers with confidence in its safety performance. Mahindra aims to cater to the evolving needs of modern car buyers by delivering a well-rounded vehicle that excels in all key areas.

# Mahindra XUV 3XO Comprehensive Report

## Executive Summary

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is a compact SUV that combines modern design with advanced features, focusing on luxury and safety. It offers a comfortable interior, a range of technology, and comprehensive safety systems. The report provides an overview of its features, luxury enhancements, and safety technologies.

## General Features

*   Design and Styling: Dynamic and robust exterior design.
*   Engine and Performance: Petrol and diesel engine options.
*   Dimensions and Capacity: Length of 3990 mm, a width of 1821 mm.
*   Fuel Efficiency: Petrol variants range from 17.96 kmpl to 20.1 kmpl.

## Luxury Features

*   Interior Design: Soft-touch leatherette, premium seats.
*   Infotainment System: High-definition touchscreen, Amazon Alexa.
*   Comfort and Convenience: Panoramic sunroof, cooled glovebox.
*   Advanced Technology: Smart steering modes, automatic wipers.

## Safety Features

*   Active Safety Features: ABS with EBD and BA.
*   Passive Safety Features: Up to 6 airbags, robust build.
*   Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS): Level 2 ADAS.

## Tables

| :-------------------------- | :----------- | :-------- | :--------- | :---------------- |

| 1.5-liter Diesel            | 1498 cc      | 117 PS    | 300 Nm     | Manual/AMT        |

### Safety Features

| :------------------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Airbags             | Up to 6 airbags                                                  |

| Bharat NCAP Rating  | 5-star                                                           |

### Luxury Features

| Feature      | Description                                                      |

| Comfort      | Panoramic sunroof, cooled glovebox, keyless entry                |
| Technology   | Smart steering modes, automatic wipers, digital instrument cluster |

## Recommendations

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to provide a luxurious and comfortable experience with premium materials and advanced technology.

  • Interior Design: Soft-touch leatherette, premium seats.
  • Infotainment System: High-definition touchscreen, Amazon Alexa, Harman Kardon audio.
  • Comfort and Convenience: Panoramic sunroof, cooled glovebox, keyless entry.
  • Advanced Technology: Smart steering modes, automatic wipers, digital instrument cluster.

Safety Features.

Mahindra has prioritized safety in the XUV 3XO, equipping it with active and passive safety features, including ADAS and a robust build, achieving a 5-star Bharat NCAP rating.

  • Active Safety Features: ABS with EBD and BA.
  • Passive Safety Features: Up to 6 airbags, robust build.
  • Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS): Level 2 ADAS.
